issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: After certificate expiration imaging worker can't convert PV images into HVM. Worker should provide download certificate error back to back-end and back-end should restart the worker like it does for volume attachment issues.
fields.summary: Restart imaging worker if its certificate is expired

comments.body: [~vasya], what are steps required to verify this issue?

[~shaon], you need to set services.imaging.worker.expiration_days property to a day and start an import process. Wait for few days and try to run import/conversion again. The conversion should fail and system should restart imaging worker.
[~shaon], I misinformed you. I am sorry. Import does not require certificate but image conversion does. You need to register PV image and try to run it after certificate's expiration.
[~shaon], certificate expiration date is part of a certificate. It is not stored in the DB as a date.

I finally got the instance run failing after certificate expiration, but the imaging worker instance isn't restarting by itself, found no error logs in the imaging worker instance, however the following logs found in the cloud-output.log,

I have systems standby if needed.
[~vasya] [~mdshaonimran] I don't think the latest issue is related to EUCA-8651. There's no difference in starting and re-starting instances in the fix for EUCA-8651.
Imaging worker is not being restarted after certification failed. Marked for 4.1.2

[~shaon] I think "Worker instance i-ce6bb355 is being retired" mean that worker should be terminated.
{noformat}
2015-04-27 10:46:06 WARN | Worker reported failed conversion: Image conversion failed-CertificateFailure
2015-04-27 10:46:06 WARN | A task import-is-cbfdeb39 experienced fatal error. Worker instance i-ce6bb355 is being retired
....
2015-04-27 10:46:11  INFO | i-ce6bb355 state change: RUNNING -> SHUTTING_DOWN (previously PENDING)
{noformat}
and it was.... What bothers you?

[~vasya],

then, that is an equivocal response:

{quote}
Vasiliy Kochergin commented on EUCA-10482:
------------------------------------------

[~shaon], CLC provides certificate and does not throw any error. This is why worker is not restarted. I am wondering if this regression for EUCA-8651. [~spark]?
{quote}

Can you please explain what did you mean in the comment above w.r.t the subject and description of the issue?

[~shaon], Let me explain the chain of events after user requests run for PV image assuming VM's certificate is expired
1. CLC creates a task
2. Worker periodically pull for tasks to process
3. Worker get a task and start processing
4. Worker requests certificate from Euare service
5. Euare check VM certificate expiration and return error to Worker ([~spark], correct my if I am misunderstanding this step) 
6. Worker post failure to CLC that is considered not recoverable
7. CLC terminates the Worker

So it Euare service provide certificate back to Worker in the cases where it probably should not do that (I don't know how to verify that) and conversion process would go without interruption. This is why I wrote the message that I guess confused you.
This bug is no longer relevant after PV image conversion was removed from imaging worker. Import operations don't request certificates from IAM. I am resolving this bug.
